name: Blue Sun challenge deck
description:
Built a Blue Sun challenge deck to play around with during the regional I was running. Put several different things in just to show off the different things the deck could do (ex: Grims and Liz). Could easily be tweaked to be more cutthroat, but this was more of a demo/proof-of-concept experiment.

Replace the Executive Retreats with the other 2 fragments (not in the deckbuilder).

Replace the Research Stations with Will-o-the-Wisps (also not in the deckbuilder).

name: Quick Rig Mk8
Silent Killer
description: The idea is to destroy all the ICE the corp gets down and then you can just run any server cheaply. The expose ability on Silhouette is usted to check servers and ice, and to know what to forged activate so it gets trashed. I would appreciate help improving the deck, as I'm not sure this idea is working as well as intended. Do you people think it's viable?

name: The Red Coats
The NBN Late Train
description:
Everyone knows that NBN's first mission is to ride the AstroTrain to sweet sweet victory as fast as possible, but what do you do to get that train out of the station? This deck leverages the low cost Trick of Light and the much maligned Plan B to get the runner to get the train moving for you. They don't access Plan B? No problem, Use Trick to fast advance it out for two dollars, and get to hustling. They leave it alone? Get one out the old fashioned way on a SanSan.

They don't buy into your Plan B bluff? Put a real agenda down, save a token, and surprise them

As with most NBN decks, this deck is particularly vulnerable to red decks and their destruction and mill tactics, but can be siphon resilient with an agenda scoring window at two credits. Speed is critical as with any TWIY deck, but I opted for Jackson as a way to recur the favored FA method, especially as Plan B is a little vulnerable to death via random access.

Not sure it's competitive, but it's been a fun idea bouncing around since I started using Trick as a backup FA plan in other NBN decks.

name: Selective Adaptation v.1.2
description:
This is an evolution from Selective Adaptation v.1.1. I think that this deck needs a way to put the breaks on Rush/FA Corp decks so the next evolution will probably use Chakana to slow them down.

I used this against a Jinteki PE deck and all my Jinteki hate worked like a charm but I ran out of runway when Medical Breakthrough cost only 2 credits to advance. Chakana would have forced my opponent to purge viruses in order to score giving me a chance to break in and steal it.

name: Don't Take Chances
description:
Knight, Crypsis and Grappling Hook can get you past any ice you can think of. Crescentus and Emergency Shutdown add cost to the corp along with Account Siphon. Sacrificial Construct, Clone Chip and Fall Guy for recursion of Grappling Hook.

As always, comments are appreciated.

name: First Ian Stirling
Secrets and Lies
Secrets and Lies
Tennin Institute first
Nasir the Glacial Explorer
description: Cheap runs and a lot of ways to take advantage of his ability. Some success so far I think It will be more competitive once I know how to pilot it.

name: Chaosmind
Tennin Fast ETR
description: A deck with a lot of small ices with end the run, with upstalk I will put on the new code gate . The reason of small ices is for the moment account siphon, so I can restart and stay in the game with few credits !

name: Weyland fast 435
NEXT Best Thing
description: Version 1.0 of NEXT Design leveraging a one-of Overdrive draft pull of Eliza's Toybox and Upstalk's Mother Goddess and Domestic Sleepers. Burst economy and draw through Blue Level Clearance and Green Level Clearance. Turn turtle and score behind some very taxing ice.

name: Secret Agent Mac
Tag n Bad
description:
very early version of a tag-n-BadTimes archetype.

Drip econ. very very little operations, relying solely on drip econ for that late game efficiency. Your ID ability should draw you into your ability while building your econ.

Beyond a couple bombs and surprises on ice, mostly just cheap ETR to force installs, since Bad times is bad if they dont install breakers. Stuff like inside job etc is bad news for you, thus the guard. Taurus as a 1-off surprise to kill a console to get rid of MU.

name: Tenma event organizer
description:
Pretty simple deck strategy. Focus on the central servers, digging deep when you can with Indexing, The Maker's Eye and Legwork using Account Siphons as many times as possible. Its a tag-me style deck with no resources other than Same Old Thing.

Crypsis is there to help hit remotes, hopefully after you have built up your Datasucker's and money from Account Siphon.

I've had some luck digging out all my event based economy, then popping Levy AR Access to do it all over again.

name: Trash Runner
description:
Posting this now for a friend

Only play it a few times, Haven't made any initial changes yet since making it but it a really fun deck.

Data hound is so a underrated ice. I got it off trace and got a pretty powerful trace with the support of my identity and Primary Transmission Dish. I trash a Magnum Opus and rearrange AS to the 4th card.

Invasion of Privacy Is unexpected, I would try to get at least 3 cards trash if the moment is right. trashing sure gambles never felt so good.

Not sure what to change, probably take broadcast square out for something else, and I need some more money or other ways to annoy the Runner

name: Yellow MushinTest.
description:
So this is just a basic and somewhat experimental concept. I'm using Mushin No Shin to land agendas instead of the big favorite SanSan City Grid with the ever present threat of scorching should the runner be unfortunate enough to fall head on on a Ghost Branch. 3 tags is also the perfect requirement to advance an AstroScript Pilot Program using Psychographics and we all know things can get pretty sweet from there.

The reason why I really wanted MNM is because now with all that's come out NBN feels like it's become the poorest corp and aside from Weyland is arguably the one that competes the most with the runner credit for credit so it's a very efficient way to save money rather than a 6 to rez cost + slowly protecting.

Choice of ICE is very conservative.. Archived Memories is just incredible with Scorched Earth or plain malleable based on where the game is going but most NBN players have been there already so that should just about cover it.

name: Jinteki-Weyland Alliance
description: In playing a Tennin Institute deck with a Woodcutter splashed in, I found that Tennin Institute could help make Weyland ice fearsome if the Runner isn't running. So built this as a thought experiment.

name: Trick of news
HB ICE Wall
Expose Denial
pls no
description: pls

name: Connection Andy
Hit & Run
description:
This is just something I thought about at work. If you can't tell, its built to force the corp to mill cards with Joshua B. and Data Leak Reversal. Using New Angeles City Hall, you avoid the tag from Joshua B. Things like having two Underworld Contact in play comes in very handy for New Angeles City Hall.

When you feel things are sufficient, you give the Corp a Bad Publicity with Frame Job and then Blackmail the archives... or you can just deck them...

Let me know your thoughts. All opinions are wanted so lets hear them...

name: NBN: Dedicated Response Team
description: Test NBN deck with Dedicated Response Team.

name: Get Lamp
description:
It is pitch black.You are likely to be eaten by a Grue. :Use Special Order to get Torch.

(I just wanted to build a deck that matches up thematically with Whizzards t-shirt a la Zork. Also, I dont think I've make enough use of Retrieval Run)

name: Logos' Toolbox
description:
This is my take on the Kate 'Toolbox' deck. Props to @HallucinogenicApplesauce for the original.

I usually play Chaos Theory: Wünderkind, and I like to think that I've combined the breaker and program suite from the Toolbox build with the 'run early, often and opportunistically' strategy I like to use with CT. There's enough multi-access tools and Same Old Thing to take advantage of nearly every run once your rig is set up.

Just a few notes on some of the card choices:

Logos - Typically, you'll see Desperado or The Toolbox in these builds. I ditched Quality Time and have lots of ones and twos in this deck, so I like to think of the console as another Self-modifying Code, helping me get the card I want to have when I need it. The extra hand size is nice, because there's no Plascretes and I want to hold cards until I can best use them.

Chakana - Depending on who I'm playing, this is a card I'd be willing to mulligan for. Being able to slow down FA is crucial, but more importantly, no other card is going to encourage the Corp to purge more often. If the Corp burns a turn, I'm perfectly happy to hit Magnum for 8 and call it even.

CyberSolutions Mem Chip - Sure, it's worse value than Akamatsu Mem Chip, but Kate makes things cheap, and this deck uses A LOT of memory.

Snowball - I wanted two copies of Legwork, so I ditched everyone's favourite fracter and went in-faction. Plus, I kind of have an irrational fondness for Snowball (One of these days, I'll encounter a Hadrian's Wall behind a Hive and it will all be worth it).

That's about it. Give the corp hell.
